Detailed Description

Macro Definition Documentation

#define IOCTL_VPS_CAPT_SET_FRAME_EVENT_NOTIFY_PRMS   (VPS_CAPT_ISS_IOCTL_BASE + 0x0004U)

Enable callback on Nth line and endOfFrame.

For any one virtual channel, a callback could be enabled/attached on reception of Nth line.

For all virtual channels, a callback could be enabled/attached on reception of End-Of-Frame.

Attention
The callback provided by the applications, via this IOCTL, will called in interrupt context.
Parameters
cmd[IN] IOCTL_VPS_CAPT_SET_FRAME_EVENT_NOTIFY_PRMS
cmdArgs[IN] const vpsissCalFrameEventNotifyCfg_t *
cmdArgsStatus[OUT] NULL
Returns
FVID2_SOK on success, else failure.
#define IOCTL_VPS_CAPT_SET_ISS_ERR_PRMS   (VPS_CAPT_ISS_IOCTL_BASE + 0x0003U)

Enable error notifications.

When receiving from CSI2 interface or parallel interface, CAL provides mechanisms to detect / correct errors. Please refer vpsissCalErrorSource_t for supported errors. The errors are detected on instance basis i.e. these cannot be configured per handle.

Attention
The callback provided by the applications, via this IOCTL, will called in interrupt context.
The control command should be the last control command.
Parameters
cmd[IN] IOCTL_VPS_CAPT_SET_ISS_ERR_PRMS
cmdArgs[IN] const vpsissCalErrorCfg_t *
cmdArgsStatus[OUT] NULL
Returns
FVID2_SOK on success, else failure.
#define IOCTL_VPS_CAPT_SET_ISS_PARAMS   (VPS_CAPT_ISS_IOCTL_BASE + 0x0001U)

Set CAL / ISP parameters.

This IOCTL should be used to configure the CAL to receive streams.

Attention
Once the capture is started this IOCTL can't be invoked and if invoked, an error would be returned.

Once the capture is stopped, application could call this IOCTL to reconfigure.

Parameters
cmd[IN] IOCTL_VPS_CAPT_SET_ISS_PARAMS
cmdArgs[IN] const vpsissCalCfg_t *
cmdArgsStatus[OUT] NULL
Returns
FVID2_SOK on success, else failure.
#define IOCTL_VPS_CAPT_SET_ISS_STREAM_MAP   (VPS_CAPT_ISS_IOCTL_BASE + 0x0002U)

Identify ISP / NON-CAL Streams.

When CAL/ISP is operated in on-the-fly mode, where in captured streams is routed to ISP for processing. The ISP could generate multiple streams from a single stream.

Applications are expected to identify ISP streams & its associated drivers stream ID. Use this control command to do the same.

Attention
Once the capture is started this IOCTL can't be invoked and if invoked, an error would be returned.

Once the capture is stopped, application could use this IOCTL to reconfigure.

Parameters
cmd[IN] IOCTL_VPS_CAPT_SET_ISS_STREAM_MAP
cmdArgs[IN] const vpsissCalOtfStreamMapCfg_t *
cmdArgsStatus[OUT] NULL
Returns
FVID2_SOK on success, else failure.
